isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: FABCO SDA-12 - ADJUSTMENTS

note.para: Refer to GROUP 02 - General Service Information and Front Wheel Alignment for Center Toe-In Adjustment Procedures and Alignment Specifications.

step1.para: Raise the front of the vehicle with a jack and support vehicle with floor stands.
Remove the brake drum. Refer to Safety.
Turn wheel end to full stop (against wheel stop). Separate the universal joint as shown in Figure 2
Remove the nuts from the outer axle shaft drive studs.
The flange should be loose enough to remove by hand. If not, use suitable bolts in the extractor holes to remove the outer axle shaft ( Figure 3).

figure.caption: Figure 3. Installing Bolts in Extractor Holes

note.para: If oil is used for wheel bearing lubrication, care should be exercised to protect brake linings, etc.

step1.para: Remove the wheel bearing locknut and lockwasher from spindle ( Figure 4). Loosen wheel bearing adjustment nut.

Tighten wheel bearing adjusting nut while turning the hub, back off 1/2 turn and then tighten to 50 ft-lbs. torque ( Figure 4.) Back off 1/4 turn. Install the wheel bearing lockwasher with tang in the spindle keyway and one side or the other toward the bearing locknut in such a way as to fit over the dowel.
Install the outer locknut and torque to specification. With the locknut properly tightened, end play should be between .001 and .010 inch and the wheel hub should rotate freely.
Apply a bead of Loctite Gasket Eliminator No. 515 (purple) to axle shaft outer flange. Refer to Figure 43 for application pattern.
Insert the outer axle shaft into the spindle bore, rotate and align the shaft splines with the outer drive yoke splines. Rotate the shaft and yoke to align the shaft flange with the drive studs.

Back up drive yoke with suitable weight. Tap axle shaft flange end to drive the shaft into the drive yoke. Assemble the drive yoke retaining washer with a new sealing washer, and the bolt to the end of the axle shaft ( Figure 5). Tighten to 125 ft-lbs. (170 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 5. Install Retaining Washers and Bolt

step1.para: Push axially on the outer drive yoke and check for positive clearance under the axle shaft flange. The clearance should be at least .015 inch.
Install axle shaft drive stud nuts. Tighten to 125 ft-lbs. (170 N·m).
If wheel bearings are oil lubricated, refer to the Lubrication portion of this section.
